articles.title: Funeral Service for Jo Myong Rok Held
articles.content:
Funeral Service for Jo Myong Rok Held
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- A state funeral service for the late Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Jo Myong Rok, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, first vice-chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly, was solemnly held here Wednesday.
					 A ceremony for the departure of funeral procession was held.
					
					 Present there were members of the Presidium of the Political Bureau and members and alternate members of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK, members of the state funeral committee and the bereaved families of the deceased.
					
					 Amidst the playing of funeral music, the coffin was carried out of the hall.
					
					 An armored car carrying the coffin left for the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery, escorted by motorcycles.
					
					 Seen along streets of the capital where the armored car was expected to pass were more than 100 000 servicepersons of the KPA and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and people from all walks of life who lined up there to pay their last respects to Jo who was an excellent son of the party and people of the DPRK.
					
					 They were overwhelmed with deep grief, recollecting the life of Jo Myong Rok who dedicated himself to the party and the leader all his life, performed signal military merits in the confrontation with the U.S. and made distinguished contributions to the efforts to strengthen the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK and defend the independence and sovereignty of the country.
					
					 The funeral procession slowly passed through the street where servicepersons lined via Okryu Bridge, Mansudae Street, the Pothong Gate and Jonsung Square.
					
					 The armored car carrying the coffin arrived at the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery.
					
					 The funeral service took place there.
					
					 Present there were Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Choe Yong Rim, premier of the Cabinet and Ri Yong Ho, chief of the KPA General Staff, who are members of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK, members and alternate members of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK, members of the state funeral committee, officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, servicepersons of the KPA and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and the bereaved families of the deceased.
					
					 Ri Yong Ho said in his eulogy made at the service that now all party members, servicepersons of the KPA and the people are deeply grieved to pay their last respects to Jo who was an excellent son of the party and people of the DPRK and a reputed activist of the party, state and army and are overwhelmed with sorrow over his death. 
					
					 The comrade who devotedly worked for the revolutionary cause of Juche for years passed away at a time when the whole party and army and all the people are making energetic efforts to bring earlier the victory in the drive to build a thriving nation and the independent reunification of the country under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, remaining true to President Kim Il Sung's last instructions, he noted, adding that this is a great loss to the party, army and people of the DPRK. 
					
					 Jo Myong Rok's heart stopped beating but his lofty revolutionary spirit will always be alive in the minds of the servicepersons and people of the DPRK and the noble feats performed by him for the party, the revolution, country and its people will shine long along with the history of the party and the country, he stressed.
					
					 Amidst the playing of funeral music and the firing of volleys, the remains of the deceased were buried.
					
					 Then, amid the playing of wreath -laying music the wreath sent by Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, was laid there.
					
					 Placed there were wreaths sent by the WPK Central Committee, the Central Military Commission of the WPK, the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, the DPRK Cabinet, the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces and other different units.
					
					 Senior officials of the party, army and state and participants of the service observed a moment's silence in memory of the late Jo Myong Rok.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Angolan President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Angolan President
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Jose Eduardo Dos Santos, president of Angola, on the occasion of the 35th anniversary of its independence.
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger and sincerely wished him good health and happiness as well as greater success in his work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: RC Tree-planting Ceremony Held
articles.content:
RC Tree-planting Ceremony Held
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- A Red Cross tree-planting ceremony took place in Sambong-ri, Phyongwon County, South Phyongan Province, on Wednesday during the autumn period of the general mobilization for land management.
					 The ceremony was participated in by officials of the Central Committee and the provincial branch office of the DPRK Red Cross Society and RC volunteers, including schoolchildren. Also present there were Ole Johan Hauge, head of the delegation of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies working in the DPRK, and its members. 
					
					 They, after being briefed on tree-planting methods, planted acacia, maple and other trees in a mountain.
					
					 The DPRK Red Cross Society conducts tree-planting campaigns in every spring and autumn as part of the activities for preventing disasters.

articles.title: Ceremony of Lighting Flame of International Martial Art Games Held
articles.content:
Ceremony of Lighting Flame of International Martial Art Games Held
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- A flame-lighting ceremony of the 4th International Martial Art Games was held in Pyongyang on Wednesday.
					 The torch lighted from the martial art flame holder in Chongchun Street will light the flame holder of an opening ceremony of the 4th International Martial Art Games to be held in Tallinn, Estonia in February, 2011. 
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Ri Jong Gun, general coordinator of the 4th International Martial Arts Games, Hwang Pong Yong, president of the Korean Martial Arts Federation, officials concerned and martial art players. 
					
					 Among the participants were Ali Montazeri, president of the World Union of TOA Associations, Moosa Bakhshaei, secretary general of the International Federation of Pankration Athlima, Li Zong Lin, general coordinator of sponsorship of the International Martial Games Commission. 
					
					 Speeches were  made there. 
					
					 Then Ri Jong Gun handed the torch to torch carriers. 
					
					 They ran along Chongchun Street.

articles.title: 29th Yun I Sang Concert Opens
articles.content:
29th Yun I Sang Concert Opens
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The 29th Yun I Sang concert was opened. 
					 An inaugural performance was given at the Yun I Sang Concert Hall on Wednesday. 
					
					 Among the audience were Minister of Culture An Tong Chun, officials concerned, creators and artistes of national art organizations and teachers, researchers and students in the field of art education and working people. 
					
					 Also among the audience were Yun's widow and daughter, a press corps of a music broadcasting company of Germany and others. 
					
					 A speech was made by Han Chol, vice-minister of Culture. 
					
					 He expressed belief that the concert which has been significantly held under the warm loving care of General Secretary Kim Jong Il who always remembers Yun would contribute to giving momentum to the desire of the Koreans for reunification. 
					
					 Put on the stage were female solo "Do Prosper, My Motherland", duet for cello and harp, duet for viola and piano and violin concerto No. 3 composed by Yun and other numbers.  
					
					 The concert given by artistes of the orchestra of the Yun I Sang Music Institute and various other art troupes was acclaimed by the audience for their high level of representation. 
					
					 The concert will run through Nov. 12.

articles.title: Press Conferences at DPRK Missions
articles.content:
Press Conferences at DPRK Missions
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Press conferences were held at the DPRK embassies in Beijing, Moscow and Cairo between November 3 and 5 as regards the publication of the first installment of a statement disclosing the truth behind the "Cheonan" case released by the inspection group of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Officials of the above-said embassies, addressing the press conferences, recalled that the U.S. imperialists and the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors whipped up an unprecedented whirlwind of confrontation with the DPRK, far-fetchedly linking the "Cheonan" case with the DPRK as soon as it took place, as if they had been waiting for it to happen. But the DPRK termed the groundless "story about the north's involvement in the case" a sheer fabrication and a conspiratorial farce from its very outset and clarified its will to probe the truth behind the case to the last internally and externally, they declared, and continued:
					
					 Much afraid of the disclosure of the inside story about the case, the U.S. imperialists and the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors persistently objected to the field survey by the inspection group of the NDC of the DPRK and made haste to announce what they called "results of investigation" conducted by the "civilian-army joint investigation team." Recently they announced "a final report", a new fabrication, arousing criticism and ridicule among all people, staged joint naval exercises reminiscent of "demonstration of armed forces" in waters off the Korean Peninsula one after another and, at the same time, frantically kicked up a racket of international sanctions against the DPRK. 
					
					 The U.S. and the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors will never be able to escape a stern judgment by the times and history for orchestrating the hideous conspiratorial farce unprecedented in the history of the nation, they warned.
					
					 Then, they answered questions raised by reporters.
					
					 There was an interview with a reporter of Reuters at the DPRK permanent mission at the UN Secretariat and international organizations in Geneva on Nov. 5.

articles.title: Water-soluble Insecticide Applied to Hothouses
articles.content:
Water-soluble Insecticide Applied to Hothouses
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Water-soluble insecticide has been applied to the Pyongyang Greenhouse Farm and other hothouses across the country.
					 The insecticide, which does not need expensive organic solvent, is low in the production cost but high in the extermination capacity. It, dissolved by microorganisms, gives no harmful effect to the users and environment.
					
					 It has a wide range of extermination and when it is used together with other agrochemicals, the range becomes wider.
					
					 The sprayed insecticide remains effective for some ten days.

articles.title: Guidelines for National Liberation
articles.content:
Guidelines for National Liberation
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Seventy-three years has elapsed since President Kim Il Sung published the famous work "The Tasks of Korean Communists".
					 In the period of the arduous anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, the President paid a primary attention to awakening the members of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army and the popular masses to an independent and revolutionary consciousness whenever the situation turned complicated.
					
					 He authored the work during breaks in battles and marches in the autumn of Juche 26 (1937) when the main KPRA was engaged in harassment operations behind enemy lines under his command. It was printed in Sogwang, the organ of the KPRA.
					
					 After occupying many areas of China, the Japanese imperialists continued to expand the front. At the same time, they became more desperate in crackdown upon the Korean people and "punitive operations" against the KPRA for the "security of the rear"． 
					
					 With a deep insight into the prevailing situation and the requirements of the developing revolution, the President noted in the work that the situation was still developing in favor of the revolution, although the Korean revolution was faced with trials and difficulties.
					
					 He also set forth following immediate tasks of the Korean communists:
					
					 To begin with, Korean communists must broaden and step up the anti-Japanese armed struggle and lead it to victory, thus splendidly accomplishing the sacred task of regaining our country.
					
					 Secondly, Korean communists must organize and conduct more vigorously the anti-Japanese national united front movement and unite closely a wider segment of the anti-Japanese patriotic forces on a nationwide scale, so that the revolutionary forces secure superiority over the counter-revolutionary forces.
					
					 Thirdly, the Korean communists should strive to strengthen solidarity with the international revolutionary forces.
					
					 Fourthly, Korean communists must take energetic steps to found a revolutionary Marxist-Leninist party in our country.
					
					  The work provided a strategic and tactical policy to be pursued by the Korean revolutionaries and served as guidelines for their struggle for national liberation from the Japanese colonial rule.

articles.title: KCNA Brands US as Chieftain of Global Nuclear Threat and Proliferation
articles.content:
KCNA Brands US as Chieftain of Global Nuclear Threat and Proliferation 
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The Arms Control Association of the United States in its recent "report" again listed the DPRK as "a dangerous state proliferating nuclear and missile technologies." Its executive director asserted that "north Korea continues violating international norms related to nuclear proliferation".
					 Explicitly stating before making any conclusion, the DPRK has neither transferred any nuclear and missile technology to other countries nor singled them out as targets of nuclear attack nor threatened them with nukes. 
					
					 The DPRK has been ceaselessly exposed to nuclear threat from the U.S. since the middle of the last century. The DPRK is the only country in the world which has been exposed to such long and most direct nuclear threat. 
					
					 As early as in August 1950, just right after its start of the Korean War, the U.S. brought nuclear weapons to the Korean front and staged several exercises under the simulated conditions of dropping nuclear bombs over areas of the northern half of Korea during the war. 
					
					 After turning south Korea into the greatest nuclear powder magazine and nuclear outpost in the Far East, the U.S. posed an open nuclear threat to the DPRK, staging nuclear war exercises against it in south Korea and its vicinity every year by mobilizing lots of nuclear weapons. It was again the U.S. which listed the DPRK as one of the targets of preemptive nuclear attack in March 2002, seriously infringing upon its security, and openly singled out the DPRK as one of the targets of nuclear attack in its "nuclear posture review" in April this year. 
					
					 What the association mentioned about the DPRK in its "report" is nothing but a despicable plot to weaken the DPRK's nuclear deterrence for self-defence and isolate it in the international arena as it was part of the U.S. nuclear policy.
					
					 It is very ridiculous and foolhardy for the U.S. to dare label the DPRK "a state threatening others with nukes" as it has posed ceaseless nuclear threat to the latter. 
					
					 In misleading the public opinion by floating the story about "nuclear threat" from the DPRK the U.S. seeks a sinister intention to cover up the hypocrisy of its loudmouthed "nuclear disarmament" and its ulterior motive lurking behind it. 
					
					 The U.S. is now stepping up its moves to increase the number of strategic and offensive weapons and modernize nuclear weapons behind the facade of "nuclear disarmament".
					
					 The U.S. is getting feverish in its moves to develop conventional intercontinental ballistic missiles not carrying nuclear weapons and new type cruise missiles capable of carrying nuclear warheads as a new type "deterrent" in a bid to make up for "nuclear disarmament." It is, at the same time, getting busy securing strategic materiel necessary for coping with "a contingency".
					
					 Some days ago, the U.S. conducted a sub-critical nuclear test under the pretext of "guaranteeing the security of nuclear arsenal." It plans to conduct three more similar tests till September next year.
					
					 The U.S. which has stockpiled at least 20,000 nuclear warheads frequently stages such nuclear tests while spending a stupendous amount of funds for beefing up the strategic offensive weapons and modernizing the nuclear weapons. This is a serious nuclear threat to humankind. 
					
					 In the final analysis, the U.S. touted "nuclear disarmament" is nothing but a version of its call for bolstering its nuclear force and its theory of nuclear threat. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the U.S. divided the world into those countries who are allowed to have nuclear weapons and those who are disallowed to have access to them and has insisted on putting international sanctions and pressure upon the latter. While shutting its eyes to the moves of its allies and followers to go nuclear, the U.S. is defending them and even encouraging them in these moves. It was thanks to the U.S. that Israel could develop and possess more than 200 nuclear warheads. 
					
					 The U.S. is the chieftain and arch criminal posing a nuclear threat to the world and proliferating nukes, seriously threatening and disturbing the world peace and security.

articles.title: US Moves to Establish MD in Northeast Asia Denounced
articles.content:
US Moves to Establish MD in Northeast Asia Denounced
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The United States has recently gone frantic in its moves to establish the regional missile defense system in Northeast Asia involving the U.S., Japan and south Korea. But with no artifice can it cover up its criminal true colors as war fanatic and harasser of peace. Rodong says this in a signed commentary Sinmun Wednesday.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. has already buckled down to the establishment of missile defense system together with Japan, accelerating its field deployment. It is keen to push forward in real earnest the establishment of the tripartite MD involving the U.S., Japan and south Korea by drawing south Korea into it. 
					
					 What the U.S. takes particular notice of here is south Korea. It is the U.S. strategic calculation that if it plugs into the MD south Korea which stands in acute military confrontation with the DPRK and forms part of the Korean Peninsula bordering China and Russia, in particular, it can contain its military rivals and realize its wild ambition to seize hegemony in the region. 
					
					 If south Korea participates in the U.S. regional MD, the U.S.-Japan-south Korea tripartite MD will come into being in Northeast Asia. This may give catastrophic consequences to peace and security of Asia, to say nothing of those of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Northeast Asia is turning into the most dangerous missile hotspot in the world due to the U.S. reckless moves. The fictitious "threat" from the DPRK trumpeted about by the U.S. is sophism aimed at deploying much more armed forces for aggression in Northeast Asia and, at the same time, justifying its criminal MD moves. The U.S. attempt to hold sway over the world by dint of global missile network stretching from the American Continent to Asia and Europe under the pretext of the non-existent "threat" from someone will get it nowhere.
					
					 The U.S. reckless moves to dominate the world by force with the help of global missile network will only result in precipitating its self-destruction.

articles.title: US Has No Face to Talk about Human Rights
articles.content:
US Has No Face to Talk about Human Rights
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Nearly 400,000 confidential data of the U.S. related to the Iraqi war have been disclosed by the Internet website WikiLeaks recently. In the wake of this disclosure Congressmen let loose a whole string of jargons that they would not take issue with what happened during the previous administration, the website touched the old scars and it is better not to dig up uncontroversial matters. They even went the lengths of asserting that WikiLeaks' irresponsible disclosure of those confidential documents put the U.S. into a tight corner.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					  Such brazen-faced act can be perpetrated only by the U.S., the worst human rights abuser, as it was nothing but a gimmick to cover up the hideous crimes committed by the U.S. forces against humanity in Iraq.
					
					 The above-said new disclosure brought into bolder relief the true colors of the U.S. as a double-dealer which has perpetrated all sorts of crimes against humanity in actuality while pretending to be a "human rights champion."
					
					 It was none other than the U.S. that forced many black children and youth to act as guinea-pigs after undisguisedly organizing tests on living bodies in its homeland and used human beings as targets of radioactive tests. Numerous people are wandering about streets with no elementary rights to existence guaranteed, racial discrimination is prevalent and people are dying everyday due to the unbroken occurrence of gun-related crimes. This is the present human rights situation in the U.S. 
					
					 What merits a more serious attention is that the U.S. is perpetrating armed invasion of other countries and massacres of civilians in its occupied territories and inhuman torture and maltreatment of prisoners under the pretext of "protecting human rights." 
					
					 The U.S. talking about "human rights issues" in other countries is just like a thief crying "Stop the thief!"
					
					 The U.S. had better honestly admit to all the crimes committed by it against humanity and face a stern judgment of history.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK Rhetoric Let Loose by S. Korean Diplomatic Chief Blasted
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK Rhetoric Let Loose by S. Korean Diplomatic Chief Blasted
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, south Korean Minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade Kim Song Hwan, when interviewed by a broadcasting service, asserted the six-party talks have not yet been resumed because of the DPRK. Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a signed commentary brands this as a gross distortion of the fact and an insult to the DPRK's will and efforts to settle the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula.
					 In fact, it is none other than the U.S. and the south Korean authorities who should take action rather than uttering words as regards the resumption of the six-party talks, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean authorities should take such a practical action as stopping the racket of posing a nuclear threat to the DPRK, not just paying lip-service to the resumption of the talks if they are truly interested in it. The south Korean authorities, however, have staged DPRK-targeted war maneuvers one after another together with the U.S. under the pretext of the "Cheonan" case, increasing the danger of a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The warmongers at home and abroad had another confab on the "offer of extended nuclear deterrence" to south Korea in case of "emergency" at the recent "annual security consultative meeting" and declared the operation of the "committee for implementing the policy of extended nuclear deterrence", a blatant nuclear threat to the DPRK. This notwithstanding, Kim Song Hwan has gone so impertinent as to call on the DPRK to "show something in practice", sheer sophism reminding one of a thief crying "Stop the thief!"
					
					 The public at home and abroad is becoming increasingly assertive for the resumption of the six-party talks, influenced by the atmosphere of a number of positive developments on the Korean Peninsula. It is none other than the south Korean authorities who are much upset by the positive efforts made by the DPRK for north-south dialogue and the resumption of the above-said talks as they have been dead-set against those moves. It is precisely for this reason that they are playing a trite trick to get rid of their awkward position and wrest something from the DPRK while working hard to convince the public that the responsibility for the stalled six-party talks rests with the DPRK.
					
					 With no rhetoric can the south Korean authorities cover up their true colors as a disturber of the six-party talks.

articles.title: Koreans Called upon to Give Momentum to Atmosphere of Dialogue
articles.content:
Koreans Called upon to Give Momentum to Atmosphere of Dialogue
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities should take a sincere attitude and stand toward the north-south dialogue, away from the anachronistic concept of confrontation, and immediately stop their reckless military provocations aimed to threaten and hurt the dialogue partner, urges Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a signed article.
					 What is of paramount importance for successfully promoting dialogue and cooperation between the north and the south is to give further momentum to the atmosphere of dialogue, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The issue of paving the way for dialogue presents itself as a particularly important issue today when the north-south political and military confrontation has reached the worst phase due to the present south Korean authorities' anti-reunification moves.
					
					 The humanitarian cooperation including the reunion of separated families and relatives that were arranged thanks to the sincere efforts made by the DPRK provided the north-south relations with an opportunity to get rid of catastrophe. The DPRK is now making every possible effort to bring about fundamental improvement in the north-south relations by giving momentum to the hard-won atmosphere of dialogue and cooperation. 
					
					 This is clearly exemplified by the fact that the DPRK advanced reasonable proposals for normalizing the reunion of separated families and relatives and vitalizing humanitarian cooperation at the recent north-south Red Cross talks and proposed to hold the north-south working military talks to put under control the serious situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula and pave the way for reconciliation and unity.
					
					 Now is the time for the north and the south to boost humanitarian cooperation and resume the tour of Mt. Kumgang and thus mend the deteriorated north-south relations at an early date by promoting dialogue with a sincere attitude and stand.
					
					 The south Korean authorities, however, maintain its attitude and stand toward the north-south dialogue quite contrary to those taken by the DPRK.
					
					 They are sticking to their insincere attitude and stand, chilling the unanimous desire of the nation for brisk dialogue and cooperation between the north and the south.
					
					 It is essential to stop all provocative acts against the dialogue partner in order to give momentum to the atmosphere of dialogue.
					
					 There still go on in south Korea anti-DPRK hostile acts which reached a reckless phase due to the conspiratorial case of warship sinking.
					
					 The south Korean warlike forces are staging ceaseless anti-DPRK war exercises under various codenames, while crying out for "deterring provocations" and "taking up a posture to cope with them."
					
					 It is imperative to remove as early as possible the stumbling block laid in the way of north-south dialogue by the south Korean authorities, the article concludes.

articles.title: Chairman of Human Rights Committee of S. Korea Accused
articles.content:
Chairman of Human Rights Committee of S. Korea Accused
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Lawmakers from the Democratic Party of south Korea at a meeting on Nov. 5 assailed Hyon Pyong Chol, chairman of the Human Rights Committee, for his dictatorial act of abusing human rights.
					 They accused Hyon of deliberately making a retrogressive revision of the rules for steering the committee in such a manner that the function of its standing committee might be weakened and his authority be boosted. 
					
					 This has completely reduced the committee to a waiting maid of the government, they charged, asserting that there would be no ground for the committee to exist any longer if it had lost its independence.
					
					 They demanded Hyon step down at once, owning the responsibility for the situation.
					
					 Human rights organizations launched a sit-in strike in demand of the ouster of Hyon from the committee on Nov. 4.

articles.title: DPRK Government's Just Measures Supported in Italy
articles.content:
DPRK Government's Just Measures Supported in Italy
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- The Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy and the Italian Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea jointly issued a statement on Nov. 4 in support of the first installment of the statement disclosing the truth behind the "Cheonan" case released by the inspection group of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and in denunciation of the moves of the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet authorities against the DPRK. 
					 The "report" released by the U.S. and the south Korean authorities is devoid of any scientific and logical evidence but full of falsity and deception, the statement said, adding that they have staged joint military exercises targeted against the DPRK one after another in the waters off the Korean Peninsula and frantically kicked up the racket for applying sanctions against the DPRK in the international arena.  This reminds one of a thief crying "Stop the thief!" 
					
					 All the facts go to prove that the U.S. is working hard to invent a pretext to attack the DPRK by force at any cost to realize its ambition to dominate Asia and the rest of the world and that the south Korean authorities are more actively toeing the U.S. line to do harm to the fellow countrymen, the statement noted, and went on: 
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean authorities are leaving no means untried to check the advance of socialist Korea but the just cause of the Korean people to build an economic power and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country is sure to emerge victorious.
					
					 The Movement for Peace and Socialism of Italy and the Italian Committee for Reunification and Peace in Korea resolutely denounce the moves of the U.S. and the south Korean authorities against the DPRK and extend full support and solidarity to the just measures taken by the DPRK government for peace and security of the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia.
					
					 The statement called upon the progressive political parties and organizations of Italy to accuse the U.S. and the south Korean authorities of having fabricated the "Cheonan" case and extend support and encouragement to the struggle of the Korean people to defend the sovereignty of the nation and achieve peace and reunification of the peninsula.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Story of Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- One September day in Juche 60 (1971) General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited the Chongbong Bivouac. 
					 Seeing all slogans written on barked trees by revolutionary fighters when they billeted there during the anti-Japanese armed struggle, he said that they were very important things and that some other countries preserved only several documents concerning the struggle guided by the working-class leaders and boasted of them but the Korean people had many slogan-bearing trees much more significant than them. 
					
					 He then said the trees in the bivouac were assets of the country more valuable than anything else in the world, so they should be preserved well. 
					
					 Reflected in his remark was his noble intention to convey down through generations the slogan-bearing trees related to the glorious revolutionary history and undying feats of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: EE.UU. es culpable principal de amenaza nuclear, comenta ATCC
articles.content:
EE.UU. es culpable principal de amenaza nuclear, comenta ATCC
Pyongyang, 10 de noviembre (ATCC) -- En su "informe" recien publicado, la Asociacion de Control de Armas de Estados Unidos volvio a acusar a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea como "pais amenazador con la proliferacion de las tecnicas nucleares y de misiles". El director ejecutivo de esta entidad peroro tambien que el "Norte de Corea sigue violando los reglamentos internacionales relativos a la proliferacion nuclear".
					  A adelantar la conclusion, la RPDC no ha trasladado nunca las tecnicas nucleares y de misiles a otros paises ni chantajeado a estos con armas nucleares definiendolos como blancos de ataque nuclear.
					
					  Al contrario, durante varias decadas desde mediados del siglo pasado hasta la fecha, vivio bajo la constante amenaza nuclear proveniente de EE.UU. En este mundo no hay otro pais como la RPDC que ha sufrido la amenaza nuclear mas directa y larga.
					
					  Ya en agosto de 1950, inmediatamente despues de provocada la guerra coreana, EE.UU. introdujo los artefactos nucleares en el frente coreano y realizo en varias ocasiones durante la guerra el ejercicio para lanzarlos en la extension de la RPDC.
					
					  Convirtio el Sur de Corea en el arsenal nuclear mas grande del Extremo Oriente y la base nuclear avanzada y ejercio la abierta amenaza nuclear a la RPDC desarrollando cada ano con muchas armas nucleares los ejercicios belicos en el Sur de Corea y su contorno.
					
					  Tambien, atento gravemente la seguridad de la RPDC al incluirla en marzo de 2002 en la lista de objetos de ataque nuclear preventivo y volvio a hacerlo al publicar en abril de este ano el "informe de revision del estado nuclear".
					
					  Este "informe" elaborado y publicado por la Asociacion de Control de Armas deviene la continuacion de tal politica nuclear de EE.UU. sobre la RPDC y no pasa de ser una artimana sucia para debilitar el disuasivo nuclear de autodefensa de la segunda y aislarla en la escena internacional.
					
					  EE.UU. que da incesante amenaza nuclear a la RPDC trata de tildarla del "pais amenazador nuclear", lo cual resulta un acto muy absurdo.
					
					  EE.UU. engana la opinion publica hablando de la "amenaza nuclear" de la RPDC partiendo de su malsano intento de encubrir el caracter falso y verdadera meta de su cantinela de "desarme nuclear".
					
					  Detras de la cortina de "desarme nuclear", EE.UU. acelera ahora el aumento de armas de ataque estrategico y la modernizacion de artefactos nucleares.
					
					  Como nuevo "remedio disuasorio" segun la teoria de "desarme nuclear", desarrolla con premura el misil balistico intercontinental convencional sin la ojiva nuclear y hasta el misil crucero de nuevo tipo capaz de cargarla.
					
					　Igualmente, asegura los materiales estrategicos de reserva necesarios al "tiempo de emergencia".
					
					   Hace poco, realizo la prueba nuclear subcritica hablando de "garantizar la estabilidad del arsenal nuclear" y planea ejecutar 3 pruebas del mismo tipo hasta septiembre del ano proximo.
					
					  EE.UU., que posee mas de 20 mil ojivas nucleares, invierte fabulosos fondos en el aumento de armas de ataque estrategico y la modernizacion de armas nucleares e intenta desarrollar frecuentemente las pruebas nucleares, lo cual deviene grave amenaza nuclear a la humanidad.
					
					  En fin de cuentas, el "desarme nuclear" pregonado por EE.UU. significa en realidad la teoria de aumento de fuerzas armadas nucleares y de amenaza nuclear.
					
					  Por otra parte, ese imperio divide a los paises en el grupo de los que pueden poseer las armas nucleares y en el que no puede hacerlo y aboga por aplicar la sancion y presion internacional contra el segundo grupo.
					
					  Por otra parte, ampara y hasta promueve el armamento nuclear de sus paises aliados y satelites.
					
					  Gracias a la pauta de doble rasero de EE.UU., Israel pudo desarrollar y almacenar mas de 200 armas nucleares.
					
					  EE.UU., que amenaza y destruye gravemente la paz y la seguridad del mundo, es el culpable principal de la amenaza y proliferacion nucleares en el mundo.

articles.title: Desarrollado nuevo producto agroquimico soluble
articles.content:
Desarrollado nuevo producto agroquimico soluble
Pyongyang, 10 de noviembre (ATCC) -- En estos tiempos, la Granja de Invernaderos de Pyongyang y otros invernaculos en distintas localidades del pais usan el nuevo producto agroquimico soluble.
					　Este producto barato no requiere ningun disolvente caro y muestra grandes efectos insecticidas.
					
					　Los especialistas lo evaluan positivamente porque no afecta la salud de los usuarios ni el medioambiente.
					
					　La eficiencia del nuevo producto biodegradable dura 10 dias mas o menos y el perimetro de su uso como insecticida se amplia si se emplea con agroquimicos de otra serie.

articles.title: Miembros de la cruz roja plantan arboles
articles.content:
Miembros de la cruz roja plantan arboles
Pyongyang, 10 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Con motivo del periodo del movimiento general para la administracion territorial en la estacion otonal, tuvo lugar el dia 10 en la comuna de Sambong del distrito de Phyongwon de la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur la plantacion otonal de arboles de la Cruz Roja.
					　Participaron en esta actividad los funcionarios del Comite Central de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y de la sucursal de la misma entidad en la provincia de Phyong-an del Sur, los servidores voluntarios de la Cruz Roja, los jovenes y ninos miembros de la asociacion de la cruz roja, el jefe de la delegacion de la Federacion Internacional de la Cruz Roja y Medialuna Roja, Ole Johan Hauge, y otros miembros, que trabajan en la PRDC.
					
					　Tras escuchar las explicaciones sobre el metodo de plantacion de arboles, ellos plantaron en la montana la acacia, la arce y otros arboles.
					
					　La Asociacion de Cruz Roja de la RPDC realiza en la primavera y el otono de cada ano la plantacion de arboles como un eslabon de las actividades para prevenir los desastres naturales.
